attributes.action: Make A Seperate A&E Department For The Old People, People Aged Over 65
attributes.additional_details:
Quicker and faster treatment.
Creates more jobs.
Gives the elderly a say and a position in society.
Reputation of the NHS increases.
More jobs mean more people pay income TAX.
attributes.background:
Its absolutely traumatising seeing people triple my age wait longer than me, when they are in more pain.
I was in the A&E department, and there was a 80 year old who was on his wheel chair for around 8 hours, he was going all pale, seeing his situation made me want to cry. He had no one to talk to.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about Accident and Emergency facilities are a matter for individual NHS Trusts, not the UK Government or Parliament. We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding for NHS A&E services for over 80s, if that's something you want to happen.
